image.altText: Cheryl Fernando and Donald Craigie

props.synopsis: Thousands of Australians who collectively lost millions of dollars to failed funeral insurer Youpla could now get some of their money back, under a newly announced government scheme.

title.children: Government to pay out customers after failed insurer made millions off Centrelink payments

image.altText: A close up of a former IT worker in India

props.synopsis: Former IT worker Abhishek Mishra alleges that he owes fees and penalties on almost $400,000 in tax debts because NBN Co and EY have breached their employment obligations to remit the taxes and provide him with "proper and independent" taxation advice.

title.children: This former IT worker alleges NBN and EY failed to pay his taxes and was then sacked for blowing the whistle

image.altText: A man squats and laid a flower bouquet in front of a fallen gum tree sectioned off by safety bollards and netting

props.synopsis: The young victim of yesterday's "awful, tragic accident" involving a falling tree in Adelaide's parklands is being remembered as a "beautiful soul" who deeply loved her family and friends.

title.children: Tributes paid to 'beautiful soul' killed by falling tree in Adelaide parklands tragedy

image.altText: A sign of a waste facility with an arrow pointing towards public trailer waste.

props.synopsis: A man who was found dead in a northern Adelaide rubbish tip in 2021 was allegedly bashed and killed before he was dumped in a green waste bin, a court has heard.

title.children: Man whose body was found at Wingfield dump suffered a traumatic brain injury, court hears

image.altText: A split shot of a woman in  a dress and in running gear.

props.synopsis: "People don't just vanish into thin air," says her husband, but six days after she failed to come home from a jog in Ballarat bushland little has emerged to quell growing fears for Ms Murphy's safety.

title.children: Samantha Murphy has been missing for six days. Here's what we know

image.altText: jo jo

props.synopsis: Workers and industrial relations experts welcome new laws that aim to set minimum standards for gig economy workers, including rideshare and food delivery drivers, but business groups express deep concerns.

title.children: Gig economy workers given 'right to disconnect' under changes labelled 'anti-business' by employers

image.altText: A woman wearing a mask puts a piece of paper into a cardboard box.

props.synopsis: Countries with a combined population of more than three and a half billion people will head to the polls in 2024 to participate in presidential, legislative and parliamentary elections. So could this be the greatest test of democracy?

title.children: Elections in 2024 will test democracy like never before, as almost half the world goes to polls

image.altText: Roz Hervey sitting on set at a Restless Dance Theatre rehearsal

props.synopsis: A Motor Neurone Disease diagnosis means time is ticking for arts veteran Roz Hervey, making her determined to make memories whenever she can.

title.children: Arts veteran looking at stars, watching sunsets and preparing for Adelaide Festival after MND diagnosis

image.altText: A court build with a columned verandah and a blue coloured building behind

props.synopsis: An Adelaide grandmother charged with attempting to traffic cocaine, worth millions of dollars, has had her charges dropped.

title.children: Cocaine trafficking charges against Adelaide grandmother dropped

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and tie outside

props.synopsis: More than 27,000 voters in the marginal inner Adelaide electorate of Dunstan will head to the polls in March to elect a new MP following former premier Steven Marshall's resignation.

title.children: Dunstan voters prepare for March by-election triggered by former premier's departure

image.altText: Two election posters on a stobie pole showing Peter Malinauskas and Steven Marshall. In the background is the city skyline

props.synopsis: Election corflutes are set to be banned from public infrastructure after the South Australian government backed laws introduced to state parliament by the opposition leader almost two years ago.

title.children: South Australian parliament set to ban election posters from power and light poles

image.altText: Members of the public at a crowded beach during sunset.

props.synopsis: Global temperatures through January have been the hottest on record, extending the run of unprecedented temperatures to eight months. For Australia, it's the third hottest January on record.

title.children: Run of unprecedented temperatures continues after warmest January on record

image.altText: Jess Murphy crying, standing in front of her dad.

props.synopsis: Jess Murphy says she knows her mum is out there as she addresses media in a desperate bid to help the search for missing Ballarat woman Samantha Murphy.

title.children: 'Mum please come home soon': Daughter of missing Ballarat woman Samantha Murphy makes tearful plea

image.altText: close up of Wong's face, very serious, speaking into a microphone

props.synopsis: Foreign Minister Penny Wong has sought further evidence that UN aid staff were involved in the Hamas terror attacks of October 7, admitting she does not yet have all the evidence to hand.

title.children: Wong admits Australia does not yet have all evidence of Israel's UNRWA allegations

image.altText: albanese sits with his hands on his hips, watching dutton speak across the dispatch box

props.synopsis: The prime minister, obviously, is now wagering that people won't mind him breaking a promise if it lands them some extra cash in their pockets, write Annabel Crabb and Brett Worthington.

title.children: 'My word is my bond' and other one liners that seemed like a good idea at the time

image.altText: Russian soldiers in a military airplane with African locals standing nearby.

props.synopsis: The Wagner group was infamous for doing Russia's bidding across Africa but now a new organisation loyal to Vladimir Putin is infiltrating the region's coup belt.

title.children: Wagner group defied Putin in Russia, now he's replacing them in Africa

image.altText: Four people stand at the base of the Eiffel Tower holding medals.

props.synopsis: Five months from the opening of the Paris Games, organisers unveil the design of the medals for successful athletes at the Olympics and Paralympics — containing a piece of the most famous French landmark in every one.

title.children: Paris Olympic and Paralympic medallists to take home a piece of the Eiffel Tower

image.altText: A South Australian cricketer is on all fours on the grass during a match, with blood coming from his nose.

props.synopsis: Henry Hunt was out for five in the third over, left the ground early after copping a ball to the face, and his Redbacks lost to Victoria at Junction Oval.

title.children: South Australian star left bloodied after copping slog to the face in one-day loss

image.altText: Robodebt

props.synopsis: Four current or former public servants have breached the Australian Public Service code of conduct in relation to the Robodebt scheme, according to the preliminary findings of an independent investigation.

title.children: Four public servants found to have breached APS Code of Conduct over Robodebt

image.altText: A woman with cropped red hair looks off to the side

props.synopsis: US Fed member Loretta Mester says investors may have expected a rate cut in the US in March, but she wants to see more signs that inflation is definitely downwards before rates are lowered, and we're not there yet.

title.children: 'The market got ahead of itself': US Fed member joins central bank chorus pushing back on rate cut hopes

image.altText: John Setka sitting behind a number of microphones at a Melbourne media conference.

props.synopsis: Controversial construction union boss John Setka announces he will retire from the role by the end of 2024.

title.children: Union boss John Setka to retire from CFMEU

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt is surrounded by reporters with microphones and cameras.

props.synopsis: The NT workplace safety watchdog accuses Matt Wright of interfering with flight record data following a crash that killed his Netflix co-star Chris "Willow" Wilson in 2022.

title.children: Netflix star Matt Wright and company Helibrook accused of falsifying flight records

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: Bright orange liquid lava flowing down a hill with smoke risign above late at night

props.synopsis: A volcano erupts for the third time since December, pumping lava 80 metres into the air in the Reykjanes peninsula.

title.children: Iceland volcano erupts, spewing lava and hitting roads

image.altText: A woman with long white hair stands at a shop counter with items for sale behind

props.synopsis: Margreet Diment knows what it's like not having a space to relax and chat. So she opened an enterprise in Bordertown to help the many migrants affected by the housing shortage.

title.children: Town's op shop offers a place to chat for the lonely and those new to town

image.altText: An excavator cab with no windows, front or doors

props.synopsis: Police ask the public for help to identify those who smashed the machines' windows, tore off doors and wrecked internal fittings.

title.children: Vandals render earthmovers inoperable, delaying dredging at the mouth of the Murray River

image.altText: The legs of a young girl wearing pink sneakers, walking near a gutter

props.synopsis: A South Australian woman says she has been on a waiting list for occupational therapy for her autistic daughter since 2022 — and that living in a regional town makes accessing services all the more difficult.

title.children: 'I cop everything': A mother's long, fraught wait to help quell her daughter's meltdowns

image.altText: The legs of a person in yellow chains as other people hold him down.

props.synopsis: A 17-year-old who repeatedly assaulted jail staff after being unlawfully locked in his cell for 24-hour periods had not received adequate care from the justice system, a judge finds as he is jailed for a further 12 months.

title.children: 'Turn your cameras off and bash me': CCTV gives confronting insight into WA's youth detention

image.altText: A projected aerial view of the Gabba Stadium

props.synopsis: International Olympic Committee vice president John Coates says he's told the independent committee reviewing the Games master plan to "abandon" the Gabba.

title.children: Minister denies 2032 Olympics 'on the nose' after IOC's John Coates urges Gabba rejection

image.altText: a woman speaking into a media microphone

props.synopsis: The daughter of a 70-year-old woman who was stabbed to death in a shopping centre car park, says her mother "loved everybody" and urged people not to "judge the whole community by a couple of bad apples".

title.children: 'Don't judge the whole community by a couple of bad apples': Stab victim daughter's plea for unity

image.altText: A polar bear carves out a bed from a small iceberg before drifting off to sleep in the far north, off Norway

props.synopsis: Photographer Nima Sarikhani watched the bear for eight hours in Norway’s Svalbard archipelago before taking the photo.

title.children: Snap of polar bear napping on iceberg wins People's Choice Award
